p.s: Eating soup politely is dependent on the company you keep to some extent but there are some key elements to make it a pleasant experience for both the soup consumer and those seated around .
Slurping and spilling of soup are not pleasant to hear or see , so do your best to avoid these mistakes and you 'll be practicing great dining etiquette .

item.s: Be seated at the table .
If you are eating soup on the couch or somewhere else , be sure to use a Stable Tableâ„¢ or a tray , to prevent it from slopping around and making a mess , or from burning you .
Place your serviette or napkin on your lap in case you spill anything .
Break up any bread or bread roll on the side plate next to you and eat it intermittently with the soup .

See " Tips " for what
not
to do with bread and soup .
Pull the dish close to you to make sure you do n't spill the soup while eating .
Have the correct spoon .
A soup spoon is the best spoon to eat soup .
Failing that , use a spoon larger than a teaspoon but smaller than a serving dish spoon .
Fill the spoon about three-quarter the way full .
Do not overfill a soup spoon or it will spill as you lift it .
Lift your spoon carefully and slowly from the bowl to your mouth .
Continue eating soup in this manner , methodically , slowly and with care .
Always place the entire spoon into your mouth to prevent the need to slurp .
Be careful not to clank it on your teeth .

As you near the end of the soup , tilt the bowl
away
from you and not towards you .
This is considered the polite way to finish soup as there is much less risk of spilling the soup into your lap .
Rest the spoon in your bowl at the end and push the bowl away from you gently .
The etiquette applies not to some countries .
For example , traditional Japanese intend to have soup loudly to show their chef that the soup is delicious .
Avoid " feeding the ducks " in public .
This is the habit of breaking up pieces of bread and dispersing this throughout your soup .
Although tasty and a great way to mop up boiling hot soup , this really should only be a family ritual and should never be a part of dinner party or restaurant table meals .
Do not slurp soup ; it sounds awful , and it is considered very bad manners .
It will also make people think that you have n't taken any time to care about how you present yourselves to others at the dinner table .
If soup is hot , blow a little on it first .
Do this carefully and discreetly .
